alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts, Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 11 at 2:40AM MST until June 13 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR NORTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM MST Sunday and Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Arizona...Fire weather zone 102. * TIMING...Sunday and Monday. Widespread gusty winds will develop by early-afternoon, then peak in the mid-to-late afternoon, decreasing through the evening. * WIND...Southwest winds 15 to 25 MPH with gusts to 40 MPH. * HUMIDITY...5 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
